title: Best Salmon Bake Recipe
description: Cook salmon in the oven for a deliciously quick and simple dinner. The salmon is topped with tomato and green onion, and baked to perfection.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Never lose a recipe: Join MyRecipes to save and find favorites from AR & beyond Main Dishes Seafood Main Dishes Salmon Baked Salmon Recipes Best Salmon Bake 4.5 (45) 34 Reviews 13 Photos Cook salmon in the oven for a deliciously quick and simple dinner for any occasion. These salmon fillets are topped with chopped tomato and green onion, and baked in the oven to perfection. Submitted by MAGGIE1205 Updated on May 4, 2023 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 13 13 13 13 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 20 mins Total Time: 35 mins Servings: 2 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 2 servings 1 (1 pound) salmon fillet, halved 1 small tomato, chopped 5 green onions, chopped ¼ teaspoon salt ¼ teaspoon pepper Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Place salmon on a lightly oiled sheet pan or in a shallow baking dish, folding under thin outer edges of fillets for even cooking. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Top salmon with chopped tomatoes and green onions, and season with salt and pepper. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Cook salmon in the preheated oven, uncovered, until fish flakes easily with a fork, about 20 minutes. DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS  I Made It Print 79 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Best Salmon Bake 01 of 13 Photo by  DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS  02 of 13 Photo by  Debbie 04/13/2021 03 of 13 Photo by  Liz Dalton 'Lizzie' 08/31/2020 This is a good basic recipe! I added olive oil and lemon juice to give it more taste. Serves up nice with black rice. Will make again. 04 of 13 Photo by  Michael Renken 05/26/2019 Quick and easy. Spice it or add what or how you want but do not leave tomatoes out. As they kook, the juices from tomatoes keep salmon moist. It comes out so tender, juicy and very very delicious. A fantastic healthy addition to my diet 05 of 13 Photo by  Michael Renken 05/26/2019 Quick and easy. Spice it or add what or how you want but do not leave tomatoes out. As they kook, the juices from tomatoes keep salmon moist. It comes out so tender, juicy and very very delicious. A fantastic healthy addition to my diet 06 of 13 Photo by  mamalama 03/13/2018 So easy, healthy and delicious! What more could you ask for? Thank you for sharing this recipe, Maggie! 07 of 13 Photo by  Julie Quenneville Bustos 03/12/2018 We loved this recipe. I added paprika and squeezed a half a lemon before adding the tomatoes and green onions. 08 of 13 Photo by  Diana Kohar 02/07/2017 Great quick recipe - replaced green onions with leeks :) Added lemon pepper spice to enhance a flavour 09 of 13 Photo by  Adam C Lucciantonio-Hicks 12/16/2016 10 of 13 Photo by  Adam C Lucciantonio-Hicks 12/16/2016 1 2 Next You’ll Also Love Garlic Salmon 558 Ratings Dad's Candied Salmon 16 Ratings Dijon Garlic Salmon 202 Ratings Garlic and Dill Salmon 78 Ratings Lemon Dill Salmon with Garlic, White Wine, and Butter Sauce 42 Ratings Parchment Baked Salmon 95 Ratings Baked Salmon in Foil 55 Ratings Chicago Hot Dog-Style Salmon 1 Rating Garlic Lemon Butter Salmon 44 Ratings Curried Salmon Bake 62 Ratings Spicy Garlic Salmon 156 Ratings Salmon with Creamy Dill Sauce 132 Ratings Simple Salmon with Balsamic Sauce 39 Ratings Cheesy Baked Salmon 101 Ratings Salmon with Brown Sugar Glaze 1,017 Ratings Salmon with Lemon and Dill 859 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
